intro: Strobilanthes gracilis, commonly known as the slender strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
